00038 /****************************************
00039 // NOTE: class GameObject was mentioned in the Physics chapter
00040 // but is not actually used anywhere in GameCode2 source.
00041 // A Physics SDK like Novodex tracks this kind of data internally....
00042 //
00043 class GameObject
00044 {
00045         Vec3 m_Pos;
00046         Vec3 m_Vel;
00047         Vec3 m_Accel;
00048         Vec3List m_Forces;
00049         Vec3List m_Impulses;
00050         float m_Mass;
00051 
00052         void AddForce(const Vec3 &force) { m_Forces.push_back(force); }
00053         void AddImpulse(const Vec3 &impulse) { m_Impulses.push_back(impulse); }
00054         void OnUpdate(const float time);
00055 };
00056 
00057 
00058 void GameObject::OnUpdate(const float time)
00059 {
00060         if (m_Mass == 0.0f)
00061                 return;
00062 
00063         // Add constant forces...
00064         Vec3 F(0,0,0);
00065         for (Vec3List::iterator i=m_Forces.begin(); i!=m_Forces.end(); i++)
00066                 F += *i;
00067 
00068         // Also add all the impulses, and remove them from the list
00069         while (!m_Impulses.empty())
00070         {
00071                 Vec3List::iterator i=m_Impulses.begin(); 
00072                 F += *i;
00073                 m_Impulses.pop_front();
00074         }
00075 
00076         // calculate new acceleration
00077         m_Accel = F / m_Mass;
00078         m_Vel += m_Accel * time;
00079         m_Pos += m_Vel * time;
00080 }

00086 
00087 /****************************************
00088 
00089 IMPORTANT GROUND RULES FOR DEFINING ACTOR PARAMETERS!!!!
00090 
00091 1. No destructors.
00092 2. No pointers.
00093 3. Never break rules one, two, or three.
00094 
00095 Why? These parameters are marshalled over god knows what. 
00096 Could be a function call - or it could be the internet.
00097 
00098 ****************************************/
00099 
00100 #include <strstream>
00101 
00102 enum ActorType
00103 {
00104         AT_Unknown,
00105         AT_Sphere,
00106         AT_Teapot,
00107         AT_TestObject,
00108         AT_Grid
00109 };
00110 
00111 struct ActorParams
00112 {
00113         int m_Size;
00114         optional<ActorId> m_Id;
00115         Vec3 m_Pos;
00116         ActorType m_Type;
00117 
00118         ActorParams() { m_Pos=Vec3(0,0,0); m_Type=AT_Unknown; m_Size=sizeof(ActorParams); }
00119         virtual bool VInit(std::istrstream &in)
00120         { 
00121                 int hasActorId = 0;
00122 
00123                 in >> m_Size;
00124                 in >> hasActorId;
00125                 if (hasActorId)
00126                 {
00127                         in >> hasActorId;
00128                         m_Id = hasActorId;
00129                 }
00130                 in >> m_Pos.x >> m_Pos.y >> m_Pos.z;
00131                 return true;
00132         }
00133 
00134         int GetSize() { return m_Size; }
00135         virtual void VSerialize(std::ostrstream &out) const
00136         {
00137                 out << m_Type << " ";
00138                 out << m_Size << " ";
00139                 out << static_cast<int>(m_Id.valid()) << " ";
00140                 if (m_Id.valid())
00141                 {
00142                         out << *m_Id << " ";
00143                 }
00144                 out << m_Pos.x << " " << m_Pos.y << " " << m_Pos.z << " ";
00145         }
00146 
00147         static ActorParams *CreateFromStream(std::istrstream &in);
00148 };
00149 
00150 
00151 struct SphereParams : public ActorParams
00152 {
00153         float m_Radius;
00154         int m_Segments;
00155         Color m_Color;
00156 
00157         SphereParams() 
00158                 { m_Type=AT_Sphere; 
00159                   m_Radius=1.0f; 
00160                   m_Segments=16; 
00161                   m_Color=g_White; 
00162                   m_Size=sizeof(SphereParams); }
00163 
00164         virtual bool VInit(std::istrstream &in)
00165         {
00166                 if (ActorParams::VInit(in))
00167                 {
00168                         m_Type=AT_Sphere;
00169                         in >> m_Radius;
00170                         in >> m_Segments;
00171                         in >> m_Color.r >> m_Color.g >> m_Color.b >> m_Color.a;
00172                         return true;
00173                 }
00174                 return false;
00175         }
00176         virtual void VSerialize(std::ostrstream &out) const
00177         {
00178                 ActorParams::VSerialize(out);
00179                 out << m_Radius << " ";
00180                 out << m_Segments << " ";
00181                 out << m_Color.r << " " << m_Color.g << " " << m_Color.b << " " << m_Color.a << " ";
00182         }
00183 };

00246 struct GridParams : public ActorParams
00247 {
00248         Color m_Color;
00249         std::string m_Texture;
00250         unsigned int m_Squares;
00251         Mat4x4 m_Mat;
00252 
00253         GridParams() 
00254                 { m_Type=AT_Grid; 
00255                   m_Color=g_Gray40; 
00256                   m_Texture="grid.dds",
00257                   m_Squares=10,
00258                   m_Mat=Mat4x4::g_Identity,
00259                   m_Size=sizeof(GridParams); }
00260 
00261         virtual bool VInit(std::istrstream &in)
00262         {
00263                 if (ActorParams::VInit(in))
00264                 {
00265                         m_Type=AT_Grid; 
00266                         in >> m_Color.r >> m_Color.g >> m_Color.b >> m_Color.a;
00267                         char texture[_MAX_PATH];
00268                         in >> texture;
00269                         m_Texture = texture; 
00270                         in >> m_Squares;
00271                         for (int i=0; i<4; ++i)
00272                                 for (int j=0; j<4; ++j)
00273                                         in >> m_Mat.m[i][j];
00274                         return true;
00275                 }
00276                 return false;
00277         }
00278 
00279         virtual void VSerialize(std::ostrstream &out) const
00280         {
00281                 ActorParams::VSerialize(out);
00282                 out << m_Color.r << " " << m_Color.g << " " << m_Color.b << " " << m_Color.a << " ";
00283                 out << m_Texture.c_str();
00284                 out << m_Squares;
00285                 for (int i=0; i<4; ++i)
00286                         for (int j=0; j<4; ++j)
00287                                 out << m_Mat.m[i][j];
00288         }
00289 };
